Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma-led Team India are currently stationed in Barbados and are gearing up for the Super 8 round. The 'Men In Blue', start the second phase of their T20 World Cup with a match against Afghanistan on June 20, 2024.

India take on their neighbours Afghanistan, a team that has grown from strength to strength in the past few years and pose some good threat to the 'Men in Blue' as far as their bowling department is concerned.
With the Caribbean tracks favouring the spinners, India need to be at the top of their game to counter the Afghan challenge.

'The group wants to go out and do something special, good way to start the second stage of the tournament. Clearly shows that everybody wants to make a difference and obviously we take our skill sessions quite seriously. We are playing the next two games in a span of 3 or 4 days. It is going to be little hectic, but we are all used to this. We travel a lot, we play a lot and that is never going to be an excuse.' said Rohit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) posted a video on their social media handle which showcases the Indian team slowly getting into the groove and sweating it out in the training nets before they start their Super 8 round.

What grabbed eyeballs was the sight of Rinku Singh rolling his arm over in the Team India nets. The explosive Kolkata Knight Riders batsman is a travelling reserve in the squad and is waiting for his chance to come by in the ongoing World Cup.
